page.title: 04PINKHILL FARM
page.content: PINKHILL FARM USED TO BE A ROMAN VILLAGE CALLED PINKLE. THE FARM IS VERY OLD AND THEY HAVE FOUND MANY COINS AND PIECES OF ROMAN POTTERY. ON ONE OF THERE BRIDGES THERE IS A STONE FROM EYNSHAM ABBEY. THERE IS A ELIZABETHEN HOUSE ON THE FARM. THEY HAVE 313 ACRES OF LAND THEY GROW BARLEY,WHEAT AND GRASS FOR HAY.THEY HAVE 60 BULLOCKS,TWO HORSES,FIVE CATS AND A DOG.THEY HAVE 4 BARNS AND 3 WHEAT STORES.THEY HAVE HAD TO PUT UP NEW BUILDINGS BECAUSE THE OTHERS HAVE STARTED TO FALL DOWN WITH OLD AGE.THEY HAVE 4 TRACTORS COMBINE HARVESTERS AND A DRILL.BY VICKI HALL SUSIE PRATLEY AND SHARON MONEY.
